author: Stephanie Ross
title: Bitcoin ATMs: Your Gateway to Instant Transactions and Enhanced Financial Privacy
text:
The multi-billion dollar Bitcoin ATM (BTM) industry in the United States is booming again after a retrenchment during the 2022 “crypto winter.” But should this growth obscure concerns about scams and money laundering?
Unlike online exchanges, BTMs do not require users to share bank account information. They verify identities by asking for a photo ID and phone number.
Instant Transactions
Since cryptocurrency transactions are based on blockchain technology, Bitcoin ATMs are often able to complete them instantly. Users simply enter their wallet address or scan a QR code to buy the cryptocurrency of their choice.
The increasing prevalence of “
Bitcoin ATM near me” searches reflects the growing integration of cryptocurrencies into everyday life, as people actively seek out accessible and secure avenues for managing their digital assets.
The transaction is then recorded in the blockchain and instantly delivered to their digital wallet. This makes it much easier to purchase crypto on the go than using an online exchange, which typically requires a lengthy verification process.
Additionally, Bitcoin ATMs often offer more privacy than centralized exchanges by not requiring sensitive information like debit or credit card numbers or bank accounts. While some machines may ask for a cell phone number and four-digit PIN to verify identity, most do not require any personal identification information at all.
Enhanced Financial Privacy
Bitcoin ATMs don’t require users to connect their bank account or provide identification, which can be beneficial to privacy. However, these machines are still subject to Know Your Customer regulations that protect investors by preventing criminals from using these devices to steal money or identities.
Typically, the machine will ask for the user’s crypto wallet address and then print a QR code that the user can scan with their smartphone to send the bought cryptocurrency into their wallet. The transaction is then recorded on the blockchain, making it impossible for anyone without the user’s private key to access their wallet and make changes to their balance or ownership.
This is a valuable level of security, but users should be sure to follow security best practices when handling their crypto wallet private keys. For example, they should store them in a noncustodial open-source wallet. Ultimately, the trade-off between privacy and convenience is a choice that each individual will have to make based on their personal financial preferences and needs.
Convenience
Cryptocurrency ATMs are a
convenient way to buy Bitcoin by exchanging cash for the digital currency. Once you insert the amount of cash you wish to exchange, the machine will take care of the rest. It will send the equivalent amount of cryptocurrency to your wallet, usually through a QR code.
This process is fast, efficient, and easy to use. Most machines also offer a touchscreen to facilitate the transaction. Depending on local regulations, you may need to verify your identity before making a large transaction. This is to prevent money laundering and protect the integrity of the cryptocurrency industry as a whole.
Additionally, the user’s privacy is protected since transactions at a crypto ATM are not linked to a bank account. Instead, the ATM will record the purchase on a public blockchain and then transfer the Bitcoin to your wallet. Once the transaction is complete, you will receive a ticket with your transaction ID to track its status.
Interesting Related Article: “
What Functions Do Bitcoin ATMs Offer?“

author: ErJakerNROL35

2004 - Bulgaria, Eslovaquia, Eslovenia, Rumania y las ex repúblicas soviéticas Estonia, Letonia y Lituania

2017 - Montenegro se une a la OTAN.
En 2008 Bush ya dijo que quería incorporar Ucrania a la OTAN, Zelensky aprobó como estrategia de seguridad nacional la entrada de Ucrania en la OTAN. Y que EEUU se escude en James Baker si dijo que la OTAN no se iba a expandir pero que no quedó reflejado en el acuerdo escrito me suena a la confusión que tuvieron los Palestinos, Sirios que ayudaron a los Británicos a luchar contra los Otomanos con la promesa de conseguir la independencia que les había prometido UK. Lo realmente bueno, es que ahora hay nuevos actores, dispuestos a pararle los pies a los matones de siempre...

Y uno se posiciona en función de los intereses que tenga. Si mi interés es la caída de Israel y del Imperio Useño, por tanto, hago como Churchill y, si Irán plantea enfrentarse a Israel, como mínimo hablaré bien de ellos, en mi caso, en menéame. Y eso no significa que yo apoye ciegamente al régimen de los Ayatolás.
Las mentes simples intentan que la gente se posiciones en dos bandos de la forma más maniquea posible. Pero el mundo es complejo: el que hoy es tu aliado contra un enemigo difícil (por ejemplo la URSS y UK lo fueron contra la Alemania Nazi), mañana puede pasar a ser tu enemigo.

Las alarmas saltan solamente cuando es algo distinto a USA armando a Israel y amenazando al que ose insultarlo con un ataque ridículo a pie

author: glennhendry
title: Police cruiser struck during weapons and drugs arrest in Ontario town | INsauga
text:
Two Toronto residents are facing firearm and drug charges after fleeing from police in Whitby Friday.
A third suspect remains outstanding.
Durham Police were conducting proactive patrols near Paisley Court and Consumers Drive just after 2 a.m. on April 4 when they attempted to initiate a traffic stop. The driver of the vehicle did not comply and collided with the cruiser before the three occupants fled on foot. Following a brief foot pursuit, two of the suspects were caught a short distance from the scene and taken into custody.
A loaded firearm with an overcapacity magazine was seized along with additional ammunition and a magazine. One of the suspects was also wearing a body armor vest when taken into custody. A quantity of drugs and Canadian currency was also seized.
Shurron Simon, 18, is charged with five weapons charges, trafficking in morphine, obstruct police and resist arrest.
Kaivon McKenzie, 24, from Toronto is charged with dangerous operation of a vehicle, three gun-related offences, two drug trafficking counts and obstruct police.
Both were held for bail hearings.
The third suspect is described as a Black man with dreadlocks. He was wearing a white tank top, a grey and black sweater, grey sweatpants and blue crocs.
Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Det. Stuart of Central West Criminal Investigation Bureau at 1-888-579-1520 ext. 1847.
Anonymous information can be sent to Durham Regional Crime Stoppers at 1-800-222-TIPS (8477) or online at www.durhamregionalcrimestoppers.ca and tipsters may be eligible for a cash reward.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: Brian Mutembei
title: DCG Files Objection to Genesis Settlement
text:
The Genesis company, Digital Currency Group (DCG), has
opposed the settlement Genesis reached with the New York Attorney General (NYAG) office. The court mediator ruled that the settlement violated bankruptcy law by not distributing payments to creditors proportionally from available resources and by setting the distribution date instead of the petition date.
The settlement would pay the NYAG’s claims after unsecured creditors receive full payment. DCG, Genesis’ sole equity holder and a secured creditor,
says this robs it of participating in residual asset distribution under a Chapter 11 plan.
DCG alleges Genesis failed to properly weigh legal options before agreeing to settle. The firm argues that Genesis failed to properly evaluate the potential to dispute NYAG’s claims in court. Additionally, it did not negotiate arm’s length to enhance the estate’s value.
DCG has asked the court to withhold settlement approval until its objections are addressed. The firm made similar objections to Genesis’ broader bankruptcy plan last week.
The NYAG
sued Genesis in October over the collapse of its Gemini Earn crypto lending program. Genesis halted customer withdrawals in November and then filed for bankruptcy in January.
Also read:

author: Dylan Hudler
title: Heat Advisory issued for Friday, strong to severe storms possible in the afternoon
text:
WATCH: Hot & humid Friday, strong storms possible
Thunderstorms become more likely on Friday & Saturday in NC
WATCH: Hot & humid Friday, strong storms possible
Thunderstorms become more likely on Friday & Saturday in NC
AUDREY AUDREY BIESK. ALL RIGHT. THURSDAY EVENING WEATHER CHECK. FIRST DAY OF AUGUST AND MOTHS OFF TO A HOT START, RIGHT? 93 DEGREES OVER AT PTI AIRPORT IN GREENSBORO. THIS AFTERNOON. STILL REALLY HOT OUTSIDE EVEN AFTER 6:00. 91 IN GREENSBORO, WINSTON-SALEM AT 92. SOME UPPER 80S IN THE FOOTHILLS, BUT VERY WARM. VERY HUMID AS EXPECTED. THAT’S BEEN THE TREND. A COUPLE DOWNPOURS HAVE TRIED TO POP UP IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS. A COUPLE LEFT OVER IN PARTS OF WILKES, YADKIN AND SURRY COUNTIES AS WE HEAD THROUGH THE EVENING. THESE MAY TRY TO MOVE OFF TO THE SOUTH AND EAST A BIT CLOSER TO THE TRIAD, BUT ASIDE FROM AN ISOLATED DOWNPOUR, I DON’T EXPECT MANY OF US TO GET RAIN THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. WE SHOULD START OFF YOUR FRIDAY WARM AND HUMID IN THE 70S WITH A MIX OF SUN AND CLOUDS, MAINLY DRY. TO START THINGS OFF. BUT AS THE DAY GOES ON, THAT SUNSHINE IS REALLY GOING TO HELP TO WARM US UP. I’M EXPECTING IT TO BE THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE WEEK, AND BECAUSE OF THAT, HEAT ADVISORIES HAVE BEEN ISSUED FOR ALAMANCE, RANDOLPH AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES. SO PLACES LIKE TROY, ASHEBORO AND BURLINGTON ALL HAVE A HEAT ADVISORY TOMORROW FOR THAT HOTTEST TIME FRAME OF THE DAY. ABOUT 11 A.M. UNTIL 8 P.M. THAT’S WHEN HEAT INDEX VALUES COULD REACH 100 TO MAYBE EVEN 109 AT THE HOTTEST. SO CERTAINLY A DAY TO TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF. STAY COOL AND STAY HYDRATED. NOT ONLY DO WE HAVE THE HEAT, WE ALSO HAVE A LOW RISK FOR A FEW STRONG OR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING RATES ARE LIKELY GOING TO BE PRETTY BUSY BY THE TIME WE GET INTO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 1 OR 2:00, THOSE STORMS START POPPING UP IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS, AND FROM THERE THEY START MARCHING OFF TO THE EAST THROUGH THE TRIAD, AROUND DINNERTIME. AND THEN THINGS START TO WIND DOWN. BY 10 OR 11:00, YOU SAW SOME OF THOSE STORMS LOOK PRETTY NASTY ON RADAR. THEY COULD BE STRONG OR SEVERE. OUR MAIN CONCERN WOULD BE FOR MAYBE A DAMAGING WIND GUST OR TWO, AS THOSE STORMS ROLL IN. SO KEEP AN EYE ON THE RADAR TOMORROW AFTERNOON. IF YOU HAVE PLANS TO BE OUT AND ABOUT. BUT THE FIRST PART OF THE DAY MAINLY DRY. WE’RE JUST HEATING UP LOW 90S EXPECTED TOMORROW AFTERNOON WITH A NICE WARM BREEZE AS WELL. THE FOOTHILLS.
